description: A widget that can switch between [tabs](Tab). Only children of type `Tab` are supported. Since the TabFolder does not compute its own size, the width and height must be defined by the respective layout properties (e.g. either `width` or `left` and `right` must be specified).

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Sets all key-value pairs in the properties object as widget properties.

tabBarLocation.description: The placement of the tab titles. When set to `"hidden"`, the tab bar will not be visible. When set to `"auto"`, the position is platform dependent.

tabMode.description: Controls how the tabs make use of the available horizontal space. Setting the `tabMode` to `"fixed"` makes the tabs span the entire available space. In case of a very wide `TabFolder` the `"fixed"` mode centers the tabs. The mode `"scrollable"` left aligns the tabs and allows to scroll the tabs if there are more tabs than would fit in the available space. Available on Android only.

tabTintColor.description:
The color used for the text and icon of a tab.

When the `tabBarLocation` is `top` on iOS, this property affects the entire appearance of the bar. No other color properties have an effect in that configuration.

selectedTabTintColor.description: The color used for the text and icon of a selected tab.

tabBarBackground.description: The color used for the background of the bar containing the tabs.

selectedTabIndicatorTintColor.description: The color used for the underline strip of the selected tab. Only applies on Android when the `tabBarLocation` is `top`.

tabBarElevation.description: The elevation of the tab bar. Depending on the `tabBarLocation` different defaults are applied.

select.description: Fired when the user taps on a tab. The event also fires when the same tab is tapped multiple times.

scroll.description: Fired when `paging` is enabled and a tab is scrolled. The `event` parameter contains position information relative to the currently selected `Tab`. Eg.: scrolling a 500px wide tab 10% to the left sets `offset` to `50`. Scrolling 10% to the right sets `offset` to `-50`.

selection.description: The current value of the `selection` property.

offset.description: Number of pixels the current tab has scrolled horizontally.
